thread.title: WBO heavyweight champion Joseph Parker and Hughie Fury will now fight on May 6 after fight was moved
thread.title_full: WBO heavyweight champion Joseph Parker and Hughie Fury will now fight on May 6 after fight was moved

author: dfraser
title: WBO heavyweight champion Joseph Parker and Hughie Fury will now fight on May 6 after fight was moved
text:
Other Sports Date set WBO heavyweight champion Joseph Parker and Hughie Fury will now fight on May 6 after fight was moved 
Showdown originally penned for April, but had to be moved as Peter Fury faced issues regarding entry into New Zealand By Stuart Atkins Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WBO heavyweight champion Joseph Parker and Hughie Fury will now fight on May 6 after fight was moved from its original date of April 1. 
The fight was pushed back as Fury stalled on signing the contract, before putting pen to paper on Friday . Getty Images 3 Joseph Parker will fight Hughie Fury on May 6 after being rearranged 
It was delayed as his father – and trainer – Peter Fury was facing issues regarding being allowed into New Zealand due to his criminal past. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest boxing news, gossip and rumours. 
New Zealander Parker, 25 was crowned the WBO heavyweight champion last December after he beat Andy Ruiz for the vacant title. 
He was ring side at the recent heavyweight title match between Deontay Wilder and Gerald Washington where he called out WBC champion Wilder. Getty Images 3 Joseph Parker had to wait a while for Hughie Fury to sign the contract 
He has made it clear he is after a unification fight for some time now, urging Parker to go do his part and beat Fury so they can meet in the future. 
Wilder said: “I’m ready for Joseph Parker. The question is, is he ready for me?” 
“I’ve done my part Joseph Parker, now it’s time to do yours. I want to unify the division next. News Group Newspapers Ltd 3 Hughie Fury will take on Joseph Parker in New Zealand on May 6 
“With Parker and the WBO belt, and Joshua and Klitschko fighting for the IBF and WBA, at the end of the year we can combine them once and for all.” 
The WBC have sanctioned a mandatory defence for Wilder inside the last 24 hours, a rematch against fellow American Bermane Stiverne. 
Wilder and Stiverne faced each other back in January 2015 – when Stiverne was the WBC heavyweight champion.
